featured.text: Since it is cheap to produce and rich in protein, and has many uses, the soybean could provide food to the world’s growing population.
For thousands of years, the Chinese have valued highly the soybean, considering it one of the five important grains (along with rice, millet, barley, and wheat).
Besides, soybeans can be fed to a variety of other animals ranging from livestock to silk worms.

The soybean is free of cholesterol, and more importantly, the soy oil contains some special substances, called Omega 3 fatty acids, which reduce cholesterol and prevent blood from clotting in human body.
Health-conscious Americans are adding tofu, the most popular soybean product, to salads and using it as a meat substitute.

other.text: In recent years, the soybean has been used in making many different foods and has become the atom of health food.
The soybean helps to keep cholesterol down mainly because it contains __________.
In view of all these strengths, in the 1930s the United States and Canada undertook a research project in which they managed to breed an especially nutritious soybean with a high oil content.
The soybean’s high fiber content is beneficial in preventing digestive disorders.
What is the main idea of the passage? (A) Asians have used soybean produce for thousands of years.
The soybean provides food for the world’s growing population.
The prickly pear has a number of advantages over other biofuel crops, such as wheat, sugarcane, and soybeans.
The soybean is an almost perfect source of protein.
The soybean is healthful and has become popular in the western world.
One major advantage of the soybean as a food source is that __________.

definition.zh_def: 大豆，一種豆類植物，常用於製作食品和飼料。
definition.en_def: A soybean is a type of legume that is widely cultivated for its edible seeds, used in food products and animal feed.
